relevant_findings.general: No acute distress, conversant, skin slightly flushed.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Mucous membranes moist, oropharynx clear, sclerae anicteric.
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, tachycardia present, S1 S2 auscultated, no murmurs, gallops, or rubs.
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no crackles or wheezing.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, mildly distended, no tenderness to palpation, bowel sounds positive, liver edge not palpable, no suprapubic tenderness.
relevant_findings.neurological: Alert and oriented to person, place, and time, gait intact, grip strength symmetrical, no asterixis.
relevant_findings.skin: No rash, although skin slightly flushed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Urinalysis showed no leukocytes or nitrites, 6 WBC, few bacteria, with patient without urinary symptoms or systemic signs of infection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Previous CT abdomen indicated abnormal parenchymal enhancement of the upper pole of the right kidney, concerning for pyelonephritis; however, subsequent examinations showed improvement and no current evidence of pyelonephritis.
